    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell his finest apples at the market and is currently negotiating a price of 5 coins per basket with Della Plumstone, who offered 4 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm willing to offer you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are my finest apples, hand-picked and ripened to perfection. I'd say 5 coins is a fair price.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per basket of apples or reject it and attempt to negotiate a higher price.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer and attempt to negotiate a higher price.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he wandered away from his mother in the bustling marketplace, mesmerized by a stall overflowing with exotic fruits. He reached for a ruby-red pomegranate, its skin glistening like a jewel, but a gruff merchant shooed him away, his words harsh and dismissive. Cedric retreated, his heart heavy with a longing for the fruit and a resentment towards the merchant's disdain.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he watched, wide-eyed, as a traveling merchant unloaded his wagon, filled with fragrant spices and colorful fabrics. The merchant, a jovial man with a booming laugh, charmed the villagers with his stories and his wares. Cedric yearned to be like him, to possess that same charisma and the freedom to travel the world.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father to the neighboring village to sell their meager harvest of apples. While his father haggled with the villagers, Cedric observed a rival merchant, his stall overflowing with plump, juicy fruits. The rival's prices were lower, his smile wider, and his sales brisk. Cedric felt a pang of envy, a seed of discontent taking root in his heart.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him travel to a distant town to buy a rare variety of mangoes. He spent days searching, his determination fueled by the desire to outdo the rival merchant who had scoffed at his father's apples. When he finally found the mangoes, their sweetness and aroma exceeded his expectations, but the journey had been long and arduous, leaving him exhausted and questioning if the reward was worth the effort.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he secured his first independent trade, purchasing a wagonload of oranges from a distant orchard. He negotiated a favorable price, his confidence growing with each successful transaction. As he drove his wagon through the countryside, the oranges gleaming in the sunlight, he felt a surge of pride, a fleeting glimpse of the success he craved.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he returned to the village where he had first encountered the jovial traveling merchant. Now, Cedric had his own stall, laden with exotic fruits from far-off lands. The villagers flocked to his stall, impressed by the variety and quality of his wares. Cedric, however, felt a gnawing emptiness, a realization that material success did not bring the fulfillment he had imagined.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 1 coin
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 1 coin
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price so she can resell them for a profit. She is currently considering Cedric's final offer of 2 coins per apple.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm a businessman, and I need to make a profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Lennon, but these are the finest apples in the market. I'll let you have them for 2 coins, and that's my final offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Cedric's offer of 2 coins per apple or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Cedric's offer.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 4 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (d)
        BestOptionPerception

        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is at the Fruitville market attempting to negotiate a good price for apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. She is currently evaluating his offer of 2 coins per apple.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name

      Action attempt
    • reject

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant in Fruitville trying to sell fruit at the market. He recently rejected an offer and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree for some apples.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Lennon, but these are the finest apples in the market. I'll let you have them for 2 coins, and that's my final offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm a businessman, and I need to make a profit.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 1 coin for the apples or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Lennon Figtree's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he secured his first independent trade, purchasing a wagonload of oranges from a distant orchard. He negotiated a favorable price, his confidence growing with each successful transaction. As he drove his wagon through the countryside, the oranges gleaming in the sunlight, he felt a surge of pride, a fleeting glimpse of the success he craved.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he returned to the village where he had first encountered the jovial traveling merchant. Now, Cedric had his own stall, laden with exotic fruits from far-off lands. The villagers flocked to his stall, impressed by the variety and quality of his wares. Cedric, however, felt a gnawing emptiness, a realization that material success did not bring the fulfillment he had imagined.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 1 coin for the apples or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal?           Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Lennon Figtree's offer.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 5 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 5 coins

      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this, knowing that Della Plumstone wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and Lennon Figtree.

        • 1895-09-15 00:10:00
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and Lennon Figtree.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and Cedric Meadowbrook.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm willing to offer you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are my finest apples, hand-picked and ripened to perfection. I'd say 5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and Cedric Meadowbrook.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm a businessman, and I need to make a profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Lennon, but these are the finest apples in the market. I'll let you have them for 2 coins, and that's my final offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these peaches are practically bursting with sweetness. You can't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and Lennon Figtree.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look delicious, Lennon, but 6 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 5 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree, but she thinks his asking price of 6 coins is too high.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and Lennon Figtree.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this, knowing that Della Plumstone wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and Lennon Figtree.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (d)

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who is currently negotiating a price for peaches with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 5 coins for the peaches, which Lennon is considering.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these peaches are practically bursting with sweetness. You can't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm willing to offer you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are my finest apples, hand-picked and ripened to perfection. I'd say 5 coins is a fair price.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm a businessman, and I need to make a profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Lennon, but these are the finest apples in the market. I'll let you have them for 2 coins, and that's my final offer.

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who is currently negotiating a price for peaches with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 5 coins for the peaches, which Lennon is considering.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these peaches are practically bursting with sweetness. You can't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin

  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone

    • 1 coin
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this, knowing that Della Plumstone wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this, knowing that Della Plumstone wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and the other person involved in the negotiation.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this, knowing that Della Plumstone wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and the other person involved in the negotiation.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are some fine apples, but 5 cents is a bit steep for me. How about 4.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 1 coin
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Della hoping to get them for 4 cents a pound.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm willing to offer you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are my finest apples, hand-picked and ripened to perfection. I'd say 5 coins is a fair price.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a determined and independent businesswoman who is also fair in her dealings.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this, knowing that Della Plumstone wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to find a price that is fair for both her and the other person involved in the negotiation.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (b)

          Query

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the market and is currently negotiating a price of 4 cents per pound with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about 5 cents a pound for these fine apples, Miss Plumstone?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are some fine apples, but 5 cents is a bit steep for me. How about 4.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 cents per pound or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look delicious, Lennon, but 6 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about 5 cents a pound for these fine apples, Miss Plumstone?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are some fine apples, but 5 cents is a bit steep for me. How about 4.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the market and is currently negotiating a price of 4 cents per pound with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about 5 cents a pound for these fine apples, Miss Plumstone?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are some fine apples, but 5 cents is a bit steep for me. How about 4.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 cents per pound or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm willing to offer you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook and they have just agreed on a price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm a businessman, and I need to make a profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these peaches are practically bursting with sweetness. You can't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (d)

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook and they have just agreed on a price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm a businessman, and I need to make a profit.

They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who engages in negotiations with other characters like Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree to buy and sell fruit. He seems to be trying to make a profit, but has experienced both successful and potentially unprofitable deals.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept the offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (a)

Cedric retreated, his heart heavy with a longing for the fruit and a resentment towards the merchant's disdain.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father to the neighboring village to sell their meager harvest of apples. Cedric felt a pang of envy, a seed of discontent taking root in his heart.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him travel to a distant town to buy a rare variety of mangoes. He spent days searching, his determination fueled by the desire to outdo the rival merchant who had scoffed at his father's apples. When he finally found the mangoes, their sweetness and aroma exceeded his expectations, but the journey had been long and arduous, leaving him exhausted and questioning if the reward was worth the effort.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he returned to the village where he had first encountered the jovial traveling merchant. Now, Cedric had his own stall, laden with exotic fruits from far-off lands. The villagers flocked to his stall, impressed by the variety and quality of his wares. Cedric, however, felt a gnawing emptiness, a realization that material success did not bring the fulfillment he had imagined.

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
